result.execSummary:
Bryant C. Pierce Jr. was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Bryant C. Pierce Jr. was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant C. Pierce Jr.

defendant.name: Pierce, Bryant C., Jr.
defendant.address: Columbia County Jail, 403 Jackson Street, Portage, WI 53901

records.addlTxt: Granting Extradition to the State of MN

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Bryant C. Pierce Jr. appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail w/Atty Gibson Hatch. Atty Hatch states defendant would like to Waive Extradition, Court reviews defendant's rights to waive extradition, Defendant states he wishes to be extradited, Court grants extradition to the State of Minnesota, Defendant signs extradition paperwork
Extradition paperwork filed by the District Attorney's Office
